zone.line: In thier fierce flight towards the wilderness
Thier breath will sweep thee into dust, & drag
Thy body to a grave in the abyss . . .
A cloud thickens the night.
Hark! how the tempest crashes through the forest.
The owls fly out in strange affright.
The columns of the evergreen palaces
Are split & shattered.
The roots creak & stretch & groan
And ruinously overthrown
The trunks & are crushed & shattered
By the fierce blast's unconquerable stress.
Over each other crack & crash they all
intertangled
In terrible & overwhelming fall
And through the ruins of the shaken mountain
The airs hiss & howl. .
It is not the voice of the fountain
Nor the wolf in his midnight prowl.
Dost thou not hear
Strange accents are ringing
Aloft, afar, anear.-
